3.doc: ErrorText is shown instead of SupportingText, even if they are (today) independent
3.name: ErrorText

4.doc: Value contains the text, which shall be shown.
4.name: Value

6.doc: InputValue is a binding to a state, into which the frontend will the user entered text. This is the pointer a State.
6.name: InputValue

7.doc: Style to apply. Use TextFieldReduced in forms where many textfields cause too much visual noise and you need to reduce it. By default, the TextFieldOutlined is applied.
7.name: Style

8.doc: Leading shows the given component usually at the left (or right if RTL). This can be used for additional symbols like a magnifying glass for searching.
8.name: Leading

9.doc: Trailing show the given component usually at the right (or left if RTL mode). If set, the clear (or x button) must not be shown, to reduce distraction. This can be used for an Info button or a text showing a value unit.
9.name: Trailing

10.doc: DebounceTime is in nanoseconds. A zero or omitted value means to enable debounce default logic.
10.name: DebounceTime

11.doc: Lines enforces a single line if <= 0, otherwise it shows the amount of text lines within a text area.
11.name: Lines

15.doc: DisableDebounce must be set to true, to disable the default debouncer logic. This will cause a render roundtrip for each keystroke, so be careful not to break the server or cause UX issues due to UI latencies.
15.name: DisableDebounce

17.doc: If Revealed the password is shown
17.name: Revealed

18.doc: Id represents an optional identifier to locate this component within the view tree. It must be either empty or unique within the entire tree instance.
18.name: Id

21.doc: ShowZero defines whether '0' should be displayed for empty/zero values of number fields.
21.name: ShowZero

22.doc: Step allows to set numeric steps, that will be used to increase/decrease the value stepwise.
22.name: Step

23.doc: Max defines the max value of a number field.
23.name: Max

24.doc: Min defines the min value of a number field.
24.name: Min
